candidate_profile_description.summary: Anisha Kumari Kushwaha, an Artificial Intelligence Masterâ€™s degree candidate with diverse programming skills and a passion for deep learning. Possesses a background in IT development and software engineering with data mining, statistical analysis and machine learning expertise.

education.degree: Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence

experience.title: Engineer
responsibilities: Developed AI demand forecasting models for an e-commerce firm, optimizing inventory levels, identifying potential stockouts, and enabling proactive replenishment.
Achieved higher turnover rate and reduced carrying costs by 10% through effective inventory management.
Employed AI algorithms to predict employee churn, achieving a high accuracy rate of 83%. Deployed and managed machine learning models on Azure cloud.

experience.title: Software Engineer
responsibilities: Implemented a scalable Java e-commerce website development using Spring MVC, and employed the builder pattern for dynamic product creation. Collaborated with cross-functional teams for comprehensive testing.

projects.name: Email Integrity Monitor
projects.description: Processed emails for Confidentiality Breach Identification, employing tokenization, NER, and normalization to refine training data, enhancing model's ability to detect and categorize potential privacy infringements. Integrated RAG-based detection model with Llama and LangChain for superior understanding, achieving 87% accuracy in identifying data leaks.

projects.name: HealthNavigator AI
projects.description: Harnesses Data Mining and Anomaly Detection via Isolation Forests and Autoencoders to extract meaningful trends and unusual health patterns for immediate intervention. Integrating Predictive Analytics with Gradient Boosting and LSTM networks, the system forecasts health issues, achieving 91% accuracy and 95% precision.

projects.name: Neural LM Sentence Generation
projects.description: Architected tokenizer and Word2Vec framework to process data, qualitative analysis of text and employed t-SNE for data visualization. Trained Feed-forward neural network with a fixed n-gram base and compared sentences generated by the Neural LM and vanilla n-gram model, evaluating both character-based and word-based model outputs.

projects.name: Predicting Stock Market Closing Price
projects.description: Analyzed 19 years of daily stock data, applied EDA and feature engineering techniques to expanding to 20. Employed LSTM, ResNet, and LeNet models to predict daily closing prices, optimizing predictions with limited historical information, leading to ResNet achieving a 0.84 f1-score.

research.title: An intelligent deep learning approach for colon cancer diagnosis
research.description: Proposed a Deep Neural Network trained using a Genetic Algorithm for building a colon cancer prediction model, evaluated various algorithms and ML classifiers, achieving remarkable results of 98.39% accuracy.

research.title: CatBoost Ensemble Approach for Diabetes Risk Prediction at Early Stages
research.description: Conducted diabetes prediction using the CatBoost ensemble technique, achieving high precision of 0.97 compared to Logistic Regression, K-nearest neighbor, Multi-Layered Perceptron, and Gaussian Naive Bayes.

research.title: Advancement from neural networks to deep learning in software effort estimation
research.description: Evaluated, and reviewed existing ML methods performance metrics, size, time, cost, and maintenance from 80 research papers across two decades, using systematic literature review, questionnaire methodology.
